DialogueOption.Text: Hey Tephra. Got any questions about the universe for me?
Where should I look for the purple rock again?
Where should I look for the purple rock next?
Where should I look for the purple rock next?
I looked inside the drain with my Little Scout.
I swam around the geyser caves and found a Nomai mural of our Hearthian ancestors!
I found where the purple rock in the museum goes when it hides, Tephra!
Where are the Nomai Ruins again?

Dialogue.Page: *GASP* Are you taking questions before you leave, astronaut?! I've got one, I've got one!
Where does the purple rock in the museum go, astronaut?!

DialogueOption.Text: Woah, woah! What purple rock?!
It travels to a dark cave somewhere on Timber Hearth.
It travels to a sanctuary made to protect Hearthians from a supernova.

Dialogue.Page: Oh, we wanted you to look in the little drain behind the village waterwheel! You'll see it if you just follow the river down the village.
It's really cramped in there though, but if you use the Little Scout's rotating camera, you should be able to see if the purple rock is hiding in there!
Oh, we wanted you to look in the cave system inside the geysers. There's a ton of water down there, so we can't explore it..
If you wear your suit, you should be able to breathe underwater to see if the purple rock is hiding down there!
Um, that's all the spots we had in mind, astronaut!
Until we think of another way to see where the purple rock's going, I think we hit a dead end..
W-wha? You don't know about it? The purple rock in the museum that disappears when you look away!
And I don't mean when it jumps behind you and scares you.. I mean when it disappears completely from the museum!
Galena and I wanna find where the purple rock is hiding.. We have some ideas, but we need your help to look in these places, astronaut! Could you help us?

DialogueOption.Text: Sure thing! Where should I look?
Sorry, maybe later.

Dialogue.Page: Yay!!
Okay, listen up! If you follow the river down the village, you'll find a waterwheel that splishes water really loudly. Behind that waterwheel, there's a drain that the river flows into.
We think the purple rock might be hiding in there, but it's so cramped we couldn't crawl into the drain to look if it's in there.
I think you could get a look in there if you used the Little Scout, astronaut! Did you know the Little Scout's camera can look around after you launch it onto somewhere?
If you shoot your Little Scout into the drain, I bet you could use that rotating camera to look if the purple rock is hiding in there.
Come back and tell me what you find in there, okay, astronaut? We have another place for you to check if the purple rock isn't there!
Oh, oh! What'd you find inside the drain, astronaut? <Pause=2> ..A skeleton? Ewww! Why's there a skeleton in there?!
Eegh.. I guess the purple rock must be hiding elsewhere..
Well, whatever. We have another idea where the purple rock might be hiding, astronaut - and we need you to check it out for us too! Are you up for it?

DialogueOption.Text: Sure. Where's the next spot?
Sorry, maybe later.

Dialogue.Page: Yess! Thanks for helping us look again, astronaut!
Okay, um - the other place we'd like you to look is the massive cave system inside the geysers.
We need you to look in there for us, because there's a ton of water down there, and we can't hold our breaths long enough to explore it.
The astronaut's suit should let you breathe underwater.. But Riebeck told me that Hearthians used to be able to breathe underwater a long time ago too, like the little fishies do.

Riebeck said that back then, we lived in these underwater caves inside the geysers - and that we probably learned to live on land, because we would die being shot out of water by the geysers otherwise!
Since these caves were only discovered recently, nobody's properly explored them yet.. Riebeck wouldn't do it because they're too scared, and all the other astronauts are busy.
I'd hate to get your suit wet, but a suit's the only way to explore the geyser caves safely. So.. <Pause=1> Could you jump into a geyser to help us look for the purple rock, astronaut?

DialogueOption.Text: Sure, I'll give it a go sometime.
I swam around down there already! I found a Nomai mural of our Hearthian ancestors down there.

Dialogue.Page: Aw, so the purple rock's not down there either..
Um, thanks so much for helping us look, astronaut! But until we think of some way to see where the purple rock goes, I think we hit a dead end..
But wow, astronaut.. The Nomai were the cool aliens that lived in our solar system a long, long time ago, right?
If the Nomai drew a mural of some Hearthians, that means our species were already around as little fishies when they were around, right? That's crazy!
Man, if Riebeck learned the Nomai drew a mural of us, they'd probably lose their marbles!
Oooh, I bet Riebeck's gonna kick themself for turning down the chance to be the first to explore those caves.. I can't wait to see the look on their face when they hear about this!
Woohoo, I can't wait! You're gonna be the first geyser spelunker, astronaut.. The coolest type of spelunker!
Remember to come back and tell us what you find down there!
Aw... Alright then...
Woah, really?! Where does it go?

DialogueOption.Text: It travels to a glittery cave somewhere on Timber Hearth.
It travels to a sanctuary made to protect Hearthians from a supernova.

Dialogue.Page: A glittery cave? Huh... That sounds like the zero-g cave, doesn't it?
But Galena and I looked inside the zero-g cave a bunch of times, and we're sure the purple rock never went there..
We even looked everywhere outside the village! We found a purple rock that's way bigger, but that's definitely not the same purple rock..
Oh, right! There's one place on Timber Hearth we couldn't check!
There might be glittery caves around the <color=orange>Nomai Ruins</color> outside the village, astronaut! That's the one place we've never looked!

DialogueOption.Text: Why not?
Huh. Where are the Nomai Ruins again?

Dialogue.Page: We wanted to look there too - but Mayor Rutile told us not to ever go near there, because there's lots of dangerous ghost matter around there that we can't see.
Could you look around the <color=orange>Nomai Ruins</color> for us, astronaut? The purple rock might be going to a cave there that we don't know about!
Oh, but be careful if you go there, astronaut. I really want to know if the purple rock is there.. But promise me you'll watch out for the ghost matter there!
Um.. It's somewhere on Timber Hearth, outside the village!
Oh! I think there's a picture of the <color=orange>Nomai Ruins</color> framed in the museum, astronaut. If you look at that, that should help you find it!
Promise you'll come back and tell us if you find anything there, astronaut!
Um.. It's somewhere on Timber Hearth, outside the village!
Oh! I think there's a picture of the <color=orange>Nomai Ruins</color> framed in the museum, astronaut. If you look at that, that should tell you what it looks like!
Woah, really? The supernova is something the sun does, right? The exhibit in the museum taught me that.
Why would the Nomai build something like that? Is it just an emergency hiding spot in case that happens someday?
But if it is, why would they seal it up and hide it like that? There's no way to get in or out of there!
The Nomai are weeeird!
